bibl.title: In Re: Ex Parte - Donald Kerracher - Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the United States Circuit Court for the Nin- th Circuit Western District of Wash- ington Northern Division
In Re. Ex Parte: Donald MC Kerracher, Petitioner. Demurrer to Return

Comes now the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracherm and respect- fully demure to the return of C.B. Hokpins, United States Marshal, to the writ of Habeas Corpus issued herein, for the following reasons, to- wit:
I. That said Return does not state facts sufficient to con- stitute a valid return to said writ.
II. That said Return shows on its dacethat the petitioner is restrained of his liberty after the time for which he was sentenced, deducing "good time", as law provided, has expired.
III. That said Return is insufficient in law to justify the further imprisonment of your petitioner

IV. That said Return shows upon its face that your petitioner is imprisoned and restrained of his liberty wihtout due process of law, and in conflict with the statutes and Acts of Congress of the United States of America.
Respectfully submitted, JB Metcalfe, Attorney for Petitioner
United States of America, Ninth Judicial Division, State of Washington, County of King.

J.B. Metcalfe, attorney for the petitioner, Donald Mc Kerracher, respectfully cettifies that he has prepared the foregoing Demurrer, is familiar with the contents thereof, and that the same is well taken in point of law.
J.B. Metcalfe, Attorney
